meanings.definition: To relieve of a burden or load.
meanings.sent1: She felt lighter after unburdening herself of the heavy backpack.
meanings.sent2: The workers were unburdening the truck of its cargo.
meanings.sent3: After unburdening the suitcase, she realized it was full of rocks!
meanings.sent4: Unburdening his heart felt like lifting a weight off his chest.
meanings.sent5: The act of unburdening his worries onto paper brought him peace.

meanings.definition: The act of removing a burden or weight.
meanings.sent1: The unburdening of the boxes from the truck was a team effort.
meanings.sent2: Her unburdening of emotional baggage was a cathartic experience.
meanings.sent3: The unburdening of the heavy load caused a loud thud.
meanings.sent4: The unburdening of responsibilities allowed him to breathe freely.
meanings.sent5: The unburdening of the old furniture made the room feel spacious.

meanings.definition: To disclose or share one's thoughts or feelings in order to alleviate stress or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: She found comfort in unburdening her worries to her best friend.
meanings.sent2: He unburdened his fears to the therapist during their session.
meanings.sent3: Unburdening her secrets to the cat made her feel silly but relieved.
meanings.sent4: Unburdening his past mistakes felt like opening a window to fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The act of unburdening his emotions lifted a weight off his shoulders.
